main_definition: To give someone money in exchange for goods or services, as a form of compensation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exchange monetary value for goods or services.
meanings_and_examples.example: I will pay $10 for the groceries at the supermarket.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Make a financial contribution to support something, such as an event or cause.
meanings_and_examples.example: She paid a donation to help fund the local food bank's operations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To suffer punishment or consequences for one's actions.
meanings_and_examples.example: The young boy had to pay for breaking his mother's favorite vase by doing extra chores.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In gambling, it refers to the loss of money bet on a game or event.
meanings_and_examples.example: He lost all his money after several rounds of poker at the casino.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To receive an allowance or fixed amount regularly.
meanings_and_examples.example: She gets paid every Friday for her part-time job at the bookstore.
